awd_titl_txt: Hadwiger's Conjecture and Ramsey Related Problems
awd_abstract_narration:
This research project aims to study a variety of fundamental problems in the areas of structural graph theory and extremal combinatorics.  Often such problems are related to other areas including theoretical computer science, geometry, information theory, harmonic analysis and number theory. Progress on these problems will advance our understanding of related aspects of graph theory and combinatorics. The PI and her collaborators have recently made progress on most of them.  It is expected that further work on these problems will lead to new methods and applications. 
 
The project investigates problems related to the well-known Hadwiger's conjecture and Ramsey related problems. Specifically the PI and her collaborators plan to explore the following problems:  proving every graph with no clique minor on seven vertices is 7-colorable; generalizing Mader's bound for graphs with no clique minors;  studying the minimal counterexamples to Hadwiger's conjecture for  graphs with independence number two; and studying the extremal function for graphs with small Colin de Verdiere parameter; determining the exact values of Gallai-Ramsey numbers of even cycles, wheels, and   complete graphs;  and estimating the minimum number of edges of co-critical graphs. Progress on these problems  will undoubtedly lead to the development of new methods and approaches that were too far out of reach before, and are likely to allow further exciting developments.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
Hadwiger's Conjecture is universally considered one of the most important open problems in combinatorial mathematics, suggesting a deep connection between graph minors and graph colorings.  The previous best bound on the chromatic number of  graphs with no clique minor of order t was O(t sqrt(log t)) from the early 1980s. There was effectively no progress on the general case of Hadwiger's Conjecture between the early 1980s and the release of  the  breakthrough paper by Norin, Postle and the PI in 2019, which improves this bound to O(t (log t)^{b}) for any constant b > 1/4.   It provides the first asymptotic improvement to the bound in Hadwiger's Conjecture in close to 40 years. Our paper was published in Advances in Mathematics.   

During the support of this award, the PI has devoted the majority of her research effort  to training and working with graduate and undergraduate students at the University of Central Florida. The project resulted in 13 research papers published in top combinatorics journals (students under my direct supervision are in bold). 

(1) S. Norin, L. Postle and Zi-Xia Song, Breaking the degeneracy barrier for coloring graphs with no Kt minor, Advances in Mathematics 422 (2023), 109020.

(2) D. Cranston, M. Lafferty and Zi-Xia Song, A note on odd colorings of 1-planar graphs, Discrete Applied Mathematics 330 (2023) 112-117

(3) F. Zhang, Zi-Xia Song and Y. Chen, Gallai-Ramsey number of odd cycles with chords,  European Journal of Combinatorics 107 (2023), 103598.

(4) Zi-Xia Song, Some remarks on even-hole free graphs, The Electronic Journal of Combinatorics 29 (2022), P3.30.

(5) S. Norin and Zi-Xia Song, A new upper bound for the chromatic number of graphs with no odd Kt minor, Combinatorica 42 (2022) 137- 149.

(6) H. Davenport, Zi-Xia Song and Fan Yang, On the Size of (Kt, star)-co-critical graphs, European Journal of Combinatorics 104 (2022) 103533.

(7) F. Zhang, Zi-Xia Song and Y. Chen, Gallai-Ramsey number of even cycles with chords, Discrete Mathematics 345 (2022), 112738.

(8) G. Chen, Z. Miao, Zi-Xia Song and J. Zhang, On the size of special class 1 graphs and (P3;k)-co-critical graphs, Discrete Mathematics 344 (2021), 112604.

(9) J. Zhang and Zi-Xia Song, On the size of (Kt, Tk)-critical graphs, The Electronical Journal of Combinatorics 28(1) (2021), #P1.13.

(10) Zi-Xia Song, D. Yang and F. Zhang, Antimagic orientations of graphs with given independence number, Discrete Applied Mathematics 292 (2021) 163-170.

(11) D. Yang, J. Carlson, A. Owens, K. Perry, I. Singgih, Zi-Xia Song, F. Zhang and X. Zhang, Antimagic orientations of graphs with large maximum degree, Discrete Mathematics 343 (2020) 112123.

(12) Zi-Xia Song, B. Wei, F. Zhang and Q. Zhao, A note on Gallai-Ramsey numbers of even wheels, Discrete Mathematics 343 (2020) 111725.

(13) Y. Lan, Y. Shi and Zi-Xia Song, Planar Turan numbers of cubic graphs and disjoint union of cycles, to appear in Graphs and Combinatorics, arXiv:2202.09216
